newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq closes higher on tech strength.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq closes higher on tech strength.

text.p: A turnaround in shares of International Business Machines Corp and aggressive buying in high techs lifted the Nasdaq to a higher close.
The Nasdaq Composite Index was up 2.19, or 0.19 percent, at 1126.86. Declines led advancing issues by 2008 to 1932 on volume of about 426 million shares.
High tech favorites U.S. Robotics and Ascend Communications were up 3-3/8 at 51-1/8 and two at 45-1/2, respectively, in active trading.

Oracle Corp topped the over-the-counter most actives list, falling 1-1/8 to 37-7/8 after Goldman Sachs took the stock off its priority list and moved it down to its recommended list. Intel Corp closed up 3/4 at 80-1/4 in active trading.
BMC Software was up 7/8 at 681-/8 after Furman Selz said it reinitiated coverage of the stock with a buy rating.
Arnold Industries Inc was up 1-5/8 at 15-5/8 after Morgan Stanley started the company as a strong buy.
